intro: Eutaxia acanthoclada, commonly known as the rough-leaved eutaxia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, serrated leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, triangular seeds. Eutaxia acanthoclada is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas.
